snippet: All but two of Japan’s 54 commercial reactors have been idled since the nuclear disaster a year ago, following the earthquake and tsunami, and it is not clear when they can be restarted.
abstract: Japan, once one of the world's leaders in atomic energy, has only two of its 54 commercial reactors online since the 2011 earthquake and tsunami; it is not clear when the ones that are off-line can be restarted; with its last operating reactor scheduled to be idled soon, the country will have, at least temporarily, shut down an industry that once generated a third of its electricity.
lead_paragraph: All but two of Japan’s 54 commercial reactors have been idled since the nuclear disaster a year ago, following the earthquake and tsunami, and it is not clear when they can be restarted.

headline.main: Japan’s Nuclear Energy Industry Nears Shutdown, at Least for Now
headline.print_headline: Nuclear Power Nears Standstill For The Japanese
